newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Lee Kim says 1997 outlook satisfactory.
newsitem.headline: Lee Kim says 1997 outlook satisfactory.

text.p: Property developer Lee Kim Tah Holdings Ltd (LKTH) said on Tuesday it expected satisfactory financial results in 1997 from increased contributions from investments.
It said in a statement accompanying its 1996 results that turnover would be substantially higher in 1997 on completion of some construction contracts and development projects.
It said operating results would be "satisfactory" because of "increased contributions from certain investments".
LKTH reported a 52 percent fall in net earnings to Singapore $2.4 million for the year to December 31, 1996 from S$4.9 million in 1995.
It reported a 92 percent plunge in turnover to S$29.8 million from S$360.2 million for the period.
LKTH said no projects under construction in 1996 were completed during the year.
